intro: Limonium kobstanicum, commonly known as the Kobstan sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Black Sea. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils. Limonium kobstanicum is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is often found in maritime environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and floral arrangements.
